That "problem" is taken care of in a config file included in GN.

which mods do you have installed?

did you change anything about any mod you have installed?

any chance I will ever get to see a log?

1. I downloaded it from the RSS page, then I downloaded the fix and replaced the files. After that I downloaded the 2048 textures for RSS.

2. I have all the Galactic Neighborhood planet packs plus all the Near Future parts packs, TAC, and Bacon Labs.

3. Nope, all mods are in the same state as when I downloaded them. I didn't touch anything.

4. Still having trouble with DropBox...

ok, so...

regarding RSS, you don't need to download the mod from the RSS page. download the developmental version (you can find the link [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/128856-WIP-1-0-4-Galactic-Neighborhood-Integration-of-multiple-planet-packs-in-the-same-game?p=2227498&viewfull=1#post2227498))

and use that one.

if you are still having troubles it may be an installation issue, try starting with GN alone and then adding a few mods at a time, so you can find out where the issues are coming up ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I just tried that. I think I may have broken the game... At the tracking station, the focus changes from one body to another. I can confirm, however, that the stars are there.

Edit: I'm going to try adding Sigma Binary to see if that's the problem.

Edit 2: that didn't help...

Edit 3 (Mission log #3): It seems I accidentaly deleted the squad foldier from my Gamedata. That's probably what caused the bugged tracking station.

Edit 4: FINALLY! That was exactly the problem. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Edit: also, I want to ask you something. How do you choose planet packs to add into your mod? Do the developers contact you or do you choose them?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-10T20:43:25Z" title="10/10/2015 08:43  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 10, 2015</time> by Sir Hotdogwater**

> 
> Edit: also, I want to ask you something. How do you choose planet packs to add into your mod? Do the developers contact you or do you choose them?

I have a template pm that I send to a developer to ask permission to add his mod to the neighborhood.

Some of the packs I already knew, so I sent the pm directly to the developers.

Some packs were requested by users, so I checked them out and sent the pm to the developers of those that I liked.

Developers have a certain freedom regarding the star, for example I let them choose the name and the type of the star.

I always say I reserve the right to change the name if the one requested does not fit with the mod, but untill now I never changed any names.

All the star names were suggested by the related planet pack developers.

(except for OPM since "Helios" was my placeholder name when I was testing the first release of GN, and when I contacted capt he said that I could continue use that name)

> 
> I have a template pm that I send to a developer to ask permission to add his mod to the neighborhood.
> Some of the packs I already knew, so I sent the pm directly to the developers.

>

So people suggest planet packs and you choose the ones you like? Alright... (plots an evil scheme)
part of me wonders how many different solar systems i could get working together.... i mean it has to at least be 50 right?

There are not enough planet packs to get to 50 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

On my potato laptop I was able to load all compatible packs at once using "force opengl" so I expect anyone to be able to load all the packs at once. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Do we know if there are any timetables for the Kopernicus reparenting issues to be addressed? I'm getting major graphical glitches from trying to run this despite how much I want to, minorly I'm getting major Z-Fighting on the building textures for the KSS, like there's two copies of the same building in the same place. I'm not sure what the deal with that is. And then there was one where I'm on Kerbin, looking at Kerbin floating on the horizon.
